commit.message: More handful enduser test handling for devs + updated build instructions

@@ -47,28 +47,34 @@ under the License.

- Before building Syncope, you need to setup an environment variable to give Maven more memory.
+ Before building Syncope, you need to setup an environment variable to give Maven more memory. +

+

On Unix export MAVEN_OPTS="-Xms512m -Xmx1024m -XX:PermSize=256m -XX:MaxPermSize=512m" +

+

On Windows set MAVEN_OPTS=-Xms512m -Xmx1024m -XX:PermSize=256m -XX:MaxPermSize=512m

- To build Syncope simply execute (from within the check-out directory): - $ mvn install - or + To build Syncope simply execute (from within the top-level source directory): $ mvn clean install - for subsequent runs.
- To build Syncope without running any test do: - $ mvn -PskipTests - Important: For subsequent builds (e.g., after code changes are made), - run mvn clean first to build from scratch, before using one of the mvn install - commands above. - (You may also wish to run git pull after running mvn clean but before running - mvn install.) +

+

+ To build Syncope without running any test nor check do: + $ mvn -PskipTests,all

+
+

+ To build Syncope documentation execute (from within the top-level source directory): + $ mvn -N -P site clean generate-resources + The documentation artifacts are now be available under target/generated-docs/. +

+
+

Besides default, other Maven @@ -91,6 +97,13 @@ under the License. or, without Activiti and Camel support $ mvn -Pdebug +

+ Once started in debug mode, individual test methods can be executed as follows (the + + Maven Surefire Plugins rules apply here): + $ mvn test -Dtest=UserITCase#list +

+

JRebel

As with Debug, but with JRebel features enabled. $ export REBEL_HOME=/opt/jrebel @@ -168,6 +181,13 @@ $ mvn -Pjrebel enduser) and enables remote JPDA debugging on port 8000 in the running Java EE container (Tomcat). $ mvn -Pdebug +

+ Once started in debug mode, the test cases can be executed as follows: + $ cd target/enduser-test +$ nodejs/node/node nodejs/bin/protractor protractor-conf.js + where the actual tests to be run can be selected by modifying the protractor-conf.js content. +

+

JRebel

As with Debug, but with JRebel features enabled. $ export REBEL_HOME=/opt/jrebel @@ -182,13 +202,5 @@ $ mvn -Pjrebel $ mvn -Peclipse-it
- -

- To build Syncope documentation execute (from within the check-out directory): - $ mvn -N -P site clean generate-resources - The documentation artifacts are now be available under target/generated-docs/. -
